levels/index.html/title.description: 1st level: title. Arca is the name of the character in the game. I'm not sure if it can or should be translated.

levels/index.html/hints.left-right.message: This is you! You can move left and right with the <kbd>←</kbd> and <kbd>→</kbd> keys.
levels/index.html/hints.left-right.description: 1st level: tell the player how to move about

levels/index.html/hints.target.message: Move over to this kitten to rescue it. You need to rescue all the kittens you find!

levels/index.html/hints.portal.message: This is a portal. Walk in and press the <kbd>↓</kbd> key to see where it leads!

levels/editing-text.html/hints.jump.message: Try to jump over to this ledge

levels/editing-text.html/hints.edit.message: Uh Oh! You need to make the ledge longer. Click 'Edit' or press the <kbd>E</kbd> key to change the level.

levels/editing-text.html/html.im-a-ledge.description: 2nd level: level content. This must stay approximately the same length for the level to work
2nd level: level content. This must stay approximately the same length for the level to work

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.a.a.message:
Pink pantaloons! You've got it! This is the HTML source code of the ledges.
It describes the stuff shown on the screen to the right

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.b.a.message: This code is the ledge you are on...

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.b.b.message: and this code is the ledge on the right.

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.c.a.message: Each ledge starts with a <p ...> and ends with a </p>

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.d.a.message:
The writing between the two tags
is the content that is shown on screen.

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.e.a.message:
Try changing the words in the code above to make
the ledge you are standing on longer

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.e.b.message: You can write anything you want - a limerick about ledges, perhaps?

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.f.a.message: Smashing work, old chap! You picked that up faster than a squirrel on a scooter!

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.f.b.message:
Go save that kitten! And watch out -
you dont want to get on the wrong side of a banana bird...

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.f.c.message: I've heard they like to poop on thier enemies!

levels/editing-text.html/tutorial.f.d.message: Press 'Save' to close the editor and rescue the kitten! OK.

levels/creating-elements.html/hint.message: Hmmm... Looks as if we need more boxes. Try editing the level - use the <kbd>E</kbd> key or press the 'Edit' button.

levels/creating-elements.html/html.box-1.description: Space level: content. The writing on the first box

levels/creating-elements.html/html.box-2.description: Space level: content. The writing on the second box

levels/creating-elements.html/tutorial.a.message: What ho! That's Shelby the Space Dragon!
He's spent years trying to fly in a perfect circle...
I'm not sure why, but he sure knows how to Waltz.

levels/creating-elements.html/tutorial.b.message: It looks like we might need some changes here...
In HTML, a div tag is kind of like a box you can put stuff in.

levels/creating-elements.html/tutorial.c.message: The first <div> is saying "start this box"
And the </div> with the slash is saying "I've finished this box"
Click the light bulb whenever you need help! OK

levels/creating-elements.html/tutorial.d.message: Add two more div tags to reach the kitten and the portal.

levels/creating-elements.html/tutorial.e.message: Each tag needs to have the same structure as the others.

Then write a word for
the content of your box.
Finish the tag off with a </div>.

levels/creating-elements.html/tutorial.f.message: Almost all HTML elements need these opening and closing tags.
The internet is very picky about this sort of thing...
...and you wouldn't want to upset it now, would you?

levels/headings.html/tutorial.a.b.message: The HTML heading are a very big family...

levels/headings.html/tutorial.a.c.message: They go all the way from <h1> (the most important),

levels/headings.html/tutorial.a.e.message: And between you and me, they argue like a fresh bucket of shrews before a steak-off!

levels/headings.html/tutorial.b.a.message: You might have your page title as a <h1>

levels/headings.html/tutorial.b.b.message: and a subtitle as a <h2>, for example

levels/headings.html/tutorial.c.a.message: These first two headings didn't get you very far into the cave.

levels/headings.html/tutorial.c.b.message: If you created more, you might be able to reach the bottom

levels/headings.html/tutorial.d.a.message: Add a new <h3> tag at the bottom of the code.

levels/headings.html/tutorial.e.c.message: Finish it off with a </h3> - remember the /!

levels/headings.html/tutorial.f.b.message: You've got a <h3>, now you just need to do the same thing for <h4>, <h5>, and <h6>.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.a.a.message: The enemies of the kittens are devious beasts.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.a.b.message: They've made it impossible to see the path ahead...

levels/colours.html/tutorial.a.d.message: You may not know this, but there are many different coding languages.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.b.a.message: You were using HTML before, and now you need to use CSS.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.b.b.message:
CSS describes the design of a HTML page -
fonts, colours, and shapes.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.c.a.message: The CSS is this bit here, inside the <style> tag.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.c.b.message: A <style> tag is used to put CSS in HTML document, so it can change the page's design.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.d.a.message: There are three things going on in the CSS:

levels/colours.html/tutorial.d.b.message: The word body tells the browser that the bits between the curly brackets are for the whole page.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.d.c.message: background is saying that we want to change the background.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.d.d.message: And hsl(...) with those three numbers is a special code for a colour.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.e.a.message: Overall, this CSS sets the background colour of the page to bright blue...

levels/colours.html/tutorial.e.b.message: Very similar to that of a malevolent dinglebat.

levels/colours.html/tutorial.f.a.message:
Try changing these numbers in the hsl(...) part,
To change the background colour of the level.

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.a.message: Long long ago, in the times of the ancient Internet, humans lived in a world without kitten gifs.

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.b.message: Then, in 345BC (before cats), the Internet arrived.

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.d.message: They discovered something that bought great happiness and meaning to their lives... cute, fluffy, animals.

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.e.message: They searched the web for more and more; from giant pandas, to playful puppies.

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.f.message: Suddenly, kittens grew more popular, and started to appear all over the Internet universe.

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.h.message: The kittens didn't care that you, Arca, were an outcast...

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.i.message: ...rejected by the creatures of the internet, and doomed to live in the ancient ruins.

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.j.message: In fact, kittens were your only friends.

cutscenes/intro.html/subtitles.k.message: Until one by one, they started going missing...
